story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful city of Jerusalem, there lived a young Jewish boy named David. David was a kind and brave boy who loved to explore the ancient streets of his city. One night, as he was walking home from the synagogue, he saw a shooting star streak across the sky.

Excited, David made a wish upon the star. He wished for peace and happiness for all the people in Jerusalem, and for his family to always be safe and protected. The star twinkled brightly and seemed to dance in the night sky, as if granting David's wish.

As David continued on his way home, he noticed a stray kitten hiding in a corner, looking scared and hungry. David gently picked up the kitten and brought it home with him. He fed the kitten, gave it a warm place to sleep, and named it Shalom, which means peace in Hebrew.

Every night, David and Shalom would cuddle up together as David's mother told them stories of their ancestors and the miracles that had happened in their land. They would fall asleep dreaming of a world filled with kindness, compassion, and love.

And so, with the love of his family and the companionship of Shalom, David grew up to be a wise and compassionate young man who always remembered the importance of peace and unity in his community.

And from that day on, whenever David saw a shooting star in the sky, he would say a silent prayer for peace and happiness, knowing that his wishes would always be heard. And the city of Jerusalem continued to be a beacon of light and hope for all who lived there.

Goodnight, dear child, and may your dreams be filled with love and peace, just like David's. Shalom.
